toggle.heading: Here are the best liberal arts colleges in the U.S.

hero.title: National Liberal Arts Colleges
hero.description: The National Liberal Arts Colleges, including schools like Colby College and Wesleyan University, emphasize undergraduate education and award at least half of their degrees in the liberal arts fields of study.
hero.subtitle: Here are the best liberal arts colleges in the U.S.

items.blurb: Founded in 2003, Providence Christian College is a private institution. Providence Christian College follows a semester-based academic calendar and its admissions are considered less selective.

items.blurb: Founded in 1866, Rust College is a private institution.

Founded in 1871, Shepherd University is a public institution. Shepherd University offers a Greek system, where 3 percent of the student body is involved in a sorority and 4% is involved in a fraternity.

Founded in 1830, Spring Hill College is a private institution. The school has 61% of its classes with fewer than 20 students, and the student-faculty ratio at Spring Hill College is 13:1.
